headline.print_headline: Africa; South Sudan: Thousands Face Starvation, U.N. Warns
headline.main: South Sudan: Thousands Face Starvation, U.N. Warns

snippet: Three United Nations agencies reported Thursday that 3.9 million people in South Sudan, roughly a third of the population, now face “severe food insecurity.”
abstract: United Nations agencies report that 3.9 million people in South Sudan, about one-third of country's population, is perilously close to starvation due to impact of country's disruptive civil war on food production and supplies.
lead_paragraph: Three United Nations agencies reported Thursday that 3.9 million people in South Sudan, roughly a third of the population, now face “severe food insecurity.”
